brief_summary.textblock:
The study aims to answer if surgery with hook plate for acute dislocation of the
      acromioclavicular joint (AC joint) grade III and V according to Rockwood is superior to
      conservative treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Operative or Conservative Treatment of Acute Acromioclavicular Joint Dislocation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  AC joint dislocation grade III according to Rockwood with at least half a clavicular
             bone width above the acromion or grade V according to Rockwood

          -  men and women 18-65 years and able to work

          -  understand spoken and/or written Swedish or English language

          -  be able to start treatment within 3 weeks from trauma

          -  consent form signed

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  earlier injury to, or surgery of either of the shoulders

          -  simultaneous fracture of the clavicle or acromion

          -  associates neurovascular injury

          -  severe osteoporosis

          -  open dislocation

          -  open growth plate of the acromion

          -  local skin damage

intervention.description: Surgery with hook plate followed by physiotherapy
Patients will be following a program specific for AC joint dislocations

clinical_study.official_title: Operative or Conservative Treatment of Acute Acromioclavicular Joint Dislocation Rockwood Grade III and V - a Prospective Randomized Study

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in SPADI  at 24 months

other_outcome.description: Position of the AC-joint will be measured at standard radiographs and weighted radiographs
other_outcome.time_frame: Change in the position of the AC-joint from baseline to at 24 months
Change from baseline in EQ-5D  at 24 months

other_outcome.measure: Pain rated with Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in VAS at 24 months
Change in the position of the AC-joint from baseline to at 24 months

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from Baseline in Constant Score at 24 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand function (QuickDASH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from Baseline in QuickDASH at 24 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
